bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, May 10, 1924

div1.p: Kean is grateful for Baekeland's letter but agrees with Howard that it is an inopportune time to write such a letter. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to Jefferson Randolph Kean, May 10, 1924
div1.opener:
10 May 1924.
Dr. L. O. Howard,
Chief of Bureau of Entomology,
Department of Agriculture,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
I am greatly obliged to you for sending me
a copy of the very nice letter that Dr. Baekeland wished to
publish in the N. Y. Times. I am also grateful to you for
discouraging his doing so. I have written to him to explain
why it would be inopportune to write such a letter at the
present time and am sending you a carbon copy of my letter.

With much appreciation of your friendly
interest, I am,
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, J. R. Kean, Colonel, Medical Corps, USA.
